intro: Alpinia apoensis, commonly known as the Philippine ginger or Apo ginger, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other gingers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, lance-shaped leaves. Its inflorescence consists of clusters of fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. Alpinia apoensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine.
